result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Hearing on June 20, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Siddique A Qureshi in court, in custody, with attorney Mark P Powers.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for Attorney Power's motion to withdraw as counsel. State takes no position. Attorney Powers advised court that he is still seeking to withdraw as counsel. Defendant presents statements to the court. Attorney Powers does not represent the defendant on 14CF488. Court grants motion to withdraw as counsel. Court advised the defendant to apply for Public Defender representation if his father does not retain new counsel. Defendant stated he already put in a request to the Public Defender's Office, but has not heard back from them. Defendant has another pending case to be heard before Commissioner Lau this afternoon.
